programme.title: JAG: Posse Comitatus
programme.desc: Harm and Mac argue the case of a Marine pilot who used force to interfere with a local police matter that led to a man’s killing. Roberts is the investigating officer in the matter of a Navy doctor who is requesting conscientious objector status.

programme.title: JAG: The Boast
programme.desc: When an unwitting corporal boasts to a reporter that he killed an Iraqi prisoner of war, facts begin to emerge that could convict him despite his later claim that he was only lying toi mpress.

programme.title: JAG: Pulse Rate
programme.desc: Harm and Mac go aboard the USS Gillcrist to determine if a seaman’s fatal accident during a routine repair was the result of a co-worker’s dereliction of duty or worse.

programme.title: JAG: Good Intentions
programme.desc: Mac defends a petty officer and former alcoholic accused of a brutal murder after a drinking binge which renders him useless in remembering details that could help him. Roberts is entangled in the case of a Navy Commander accused of embezzling funds.

programme.title: JAG: People vs SECNAV
programme.desc: After an incident in Iraq claims the lives of innocent civilians, SecNav is brought up on charges of war crimes in International Court, and Harm and Mac must defend him. Meanwhile, during a trip to the arcade, little A.J. goes missing.

programme.title: JAG: Coming Home
programme.desc: A marine’s killing in Iraq has ramifications for JAG stateside as Harm helps the soldier’s family with a media onslaught, and Bud and Mac investigate the failure of his flack vest.

programme.title: JAG: Fighting Words
programme.desc: A general’s comments about Islam during a church service pit Harm and Mac against each other as a court-martial hearing examines whether those remarks were a danger to national security.

programme.title: JAG: One Big Boat
programme.desc: When a Naval Academy sailing team gets caught in a squall and a team member drowns, Mac and Turner must determine if their driven commander willingly put his crew at risk.

programme.title: JAG: Death At The Mosque
programme.desc: Vukovic is sent to Iraq to defend a Marine who was caught on tape killing a seemingly innocent Iraqi civilian.

programme.title: JAG: Dream Team
programme.desc: A sailor dies during a fight aboard a ship at sea; Bud discovers the explanation. Mattie wakes up and talks. The general announces a reorganization, orders, and a promotion.

programme.title: JAG: Pilot, Part 1 & 2
programme.desc: A woman radar-intercept officer (RIO) disappears at night from an aircraft carrier in the Adriatic Sea. Two JAG lawyers, Lt. Harm Rabb and Lt. Caitlin Pike, investigate and solve. Harm, a former Naval aviator, unexpectedly becomes a hero.

programme.title: JAG: Shadow
programme.desc: A civilian tech rep aboard a submarine seizes control of an experimental torpedo after its launch during an exercise.

programme.title: JAG: déjà vu (AKA Soldier of Love)
programme.desc: Three Navy lieutenants die by homicide in 11 months around Washington. Harm and Meg investigate.

programme.title: JAG: Desert Son
programme.desc: Due to a human error in an exercise, artillery fire injures seven Marines, one of whom later dies.

programme.title: JAG: Brig Break
programme.desc: A sailor has stolen two Stinger missiles from a base. Harm and Meg investigate.

programme.title: JAG: Pilot Error
programme.desc: Two Naval aviators die in a crash of an F-14 while using a new fly-by-wire navigation system.

programme.title: JAG: War Cries
programme.desc: In Lima, Peru, while a boy sneaks into the US embassy at night, a Marine guard stops him.

programme.title: JAG: Sightings
programme.desc: In south Texas, residents have reported strange phenomena, stories of supernatural events have abounded, and a 10-year-old girl has disappeared.

programme.title: JAG: Scimitar
programme.desc: Two Marines in a Humvee mistakenly drive into Iraq; an Iraqi detail intercepts them, kills one, and captures the other.

programme.title: JAG: Defensive Action
programme.desc: A patrolling F-14 malfunctions in a no-fly zone; the crew ejects, and the bird explodes.

programme.title: JAG: Boot.
programme.desc: A woman Marine recruit dies at Parris Island. Harm investigates while Meg poses undercover as a recruit.

programme.title: JAG: The Brotherhood
programme.desc: During a landing exercise Marines find a beaten, comatose fellow Marine on the beach.

programme.title: JAG: Hemlock
programme.desc: By mistake a foreign agent sends a fax to Meg's office; then he retrieves it and shoots Meg to prevent her from identifying him.

programme.title: JAG: High Ground
programme.desc: A Marine sniper receives orders contrary to a previous deal; his CO refuses to listen; the sniper takes a shot at the CO's Humvee.(n)

programme.title: JAG: Smoked
programme.desc: After a lightning strike, an F-14 wanders into Cuban airspace, and Cuban fighters force it to land.(n)

programme.title: JAG: Black Ops
programme.desc: A Naval aviator, while temporarily assigned to a SEAL team, drowns at sea; he was the son of a woman senator.(n)

programme.title: JAG: Survivors
programme.desc: In a civilian court Harm represents a divorced (and emotionally baffled) Marine colonel, who has gotten into trouble over an unauthorized visit with his minor son.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: Crossroads
programme.desc: To protect a key witness who is en route to testifying against a deadly drug cartel, Team Scorpion takes her on the run, with the cartel hot on their heels.

programme.title: Scorpion: Cliffhanger
programme.desc: Walter finally learns Cabe's long-kept secret regarding the Baghdad mission, and it threatens to tear Team Scorpion apart forever.

programme.title: Scorpion: Postcards From the Edge
programme.desc: Scorpion, torn apart and uncertain about their future as a team, must come together for their most important mission yet to save Walter's life as his car teeters on the side of a cliff.

programme.title: Scorpion: Satellite Of Love
programme.desc: The new Director of Homeland Security reunites the team when a nuclear powered Russian satellite is knocked out of orbit and must be diverted before it detonates over Southern California.

programme.title: Scorpion: Cuba Libre
programme.desc: Team Scorpion heads to Cuba when a woman from Cabe's past pleads for him to help catch a Serbian war criminal.

programme.title: Scorpion: Fish Filet
programme.desc: In order to save the lives of three judges, Sylvester goes undercover in federal prison but Team Scorpion must break him out when his life is threatened. Kevin Weisman guest stars.

programme.title: Scorpion: Robots
programme.desc: Walter, Cabe, and Happy are trapped with the crew in a top-secret submarine when an explosion sends it to the bottom of the ocean with limited oxygen.

programme.title: Scorpion: Super Fun Guys
programme.desc: Team Scorpion goes undercover on the "Super Fun Guy" movie set in Kazakstan in order to disable a Soviet-era nuclear missile being sold by terrorists.

programme.title: Scorpion: Tech, Drugs, and Rock 'n Roll
programme.desc: Walter's attempt to "normalize" goes horribly wrong when a nefarious virus is uploaded to his computer.

programme.title: Scorpion: Crazy Train
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must stop a sabotaged runaway subway train with Paige and Ralph on board. Also, in his attempt to impress Happy, Toby has his first boxing match.

programme.title: Scorpion: Area 51
programme.desc: To help fund Walter's research into saving his sister's life, Team Scorpion takes a lucrative job for the CIA to find a top-secret aircraft in the mysterious Area 51.

programme.title: Scorpion: US vs. UN vs. UK
programme.desc: Team Scorpion is blackmailed to break into the United Nations to assist in the assassination of a menacing arms dealer.

programme.title: Scorpion: Arrivals And Departures
programme.desc: When Team Scorpion and Walter's parents visit Megan in the hospital as her health deteriorates, they are quarantined after a deadly fungus outbreak threatens to infect everyone.

programme.title: Scorpion: The Old College Try
programme.desc: Team Scorpion goes undercover at a university to find a hacker who infiltrates the Federal Reserve and threatens to collapse the world economy.

programme.title: Scorpion: Dam Breakthrough
programme.desc: On Christmas Eve, Team Scorpion must prevent a catastrophe when torrential rains create a large crack in a dam, threatening to wipe out an entire town in its wake.

programme.title: Scorpion: White Out
programme.desc: In order to save a United States Special Forces unit from certain death, Team Scorpion must brave the subzero temperatures of Antarctica.

programme.title: Scorpion: Sun of a Gun
programme.desc: Sylvester comes face to face with his estranged father who asks Team Scorpion for help.

programme.title: Scorpion: Da Bomb
programme.desc: Team Scorpion is helping with NASA's top secret rocket launch, but they must sabotage their own mission.

programme.title: Scorpion: Fractured
programme.desc: After a powerful earthquake rocks Los Angeles, Team Scorpion must fix a pinched gas line to prevent a massive explosion.

programme.title: Scorpion: Adaptation
programme.desc: While Team Scorpion works to stop an influx of drugs being smuggled into the country via drones, Walter gives Happy and Toby an ultimatum on their new relationship.

programme.title: Scorpion: The Fast & The Nerdiest
programme.desc: After Sylvester scores big on THE PRICE IS RIGHT, Team Scorpion must infiltrate a high-end car smuggling operation about to ship bioweapons to South America.

programme.title: Scorpion: Ticker
programme.desc: When Los Angeles' blood supply is hacked and deemed unusable because of fear it's been tainted, Team Scorpion must find the culprit.

programme.title: Scorpion: Djibouti Call
programme.desc: While on a secret mission in Djibouti, Africa, with his new Homeland protege, Tim Armstrong (Scott Porter), Cabe is captured and Team Scorpion must save him.

programme.title: Scorpion: Twist And Shout
programme.desc: Team Scorpion's mission to recover the remains of fallen Marines in Vietnam is threatened along with their lives when a deadly tornado heads directly towards them.

programme.title: Scorpion: Hard Knox
programme.desc: Team Scorpion is hired by the Department of Defense to break into Fort Knox and "steal" a precious artifact in order to test their security.

programme.title: Scorpion: Chernobyl Intentions
programme.desc: Team Scorpion goes to Chernobyl to repair the decaying nuclear reactor before a catastrophic meltdown.

programme.title: Scorpion: Toby Or Not Toby
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must out-think their unstable ex-Scorpion member after he kidnaps Toby and threatens to kill him unless his cunning demands are met.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: Civil War
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must put aside their personal and romantic predicaments when anonymous hackers with unknown motives take control of U.S. military aircraft and warships and point weapons at American cities.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: And More Civil War
programme.desc: Just as Team Scorpion makes headway against the hackers controlling U.S. naval destroyers, they learn that a U.S. nuclear submarine also has been hacked and has a missile about to launch.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: It Isn't the Fall That Kills You
programme.sub-title: It Isn't the Fall That Kills You
programme.desc: When Walter is accidentally launched into space in a rocket, he hallucinates about Paige as his oxygen runs low, and Team Scorpion works feverishly to find a way to bring him home before he suffocates.(n)

programme.title: Scorpion: Toby Or Not Toby
programme.desc: Team Scorpion must out-think their unstable ex-Scorpion member after he kidnaps Toby and threatens to kill him unless his cunning demands are met.(n)

programme.desc: When Walter is accidentally launched into space in a rocket, he hallucinates about Paige as his oxygen runs low, and Team Scorpion works feverishly to find a way to bring him home before he suffocates.(n)

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Blink
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the night’s traumatic events, Andy and Dov try to pull themselves together at an all-night diner, but are caught off-duty and off-guard in a volatile diner hold-up.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: All by Her Selfie
programme.desc: Oliver gets promoted and Andy is tasked with training 15 Division’s newest rookie, Duncan Moore. But when Andy and Duncan respond to a messy homicide at a pawnshop, it’s clear this rookie is going to give Andy the challenge of a lifetime.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Heart Breakers, Money Makers
programme.desc: When Andy and Nick’s seizure at an illegal gambling house leads to a suspicious confession, Andy recruits Sam to help figure out who’s lying, why, and where the money is, before anyone gets hurt.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Wanting
programme.desc: When a tenement-building shooting leads to the discovery of an executed gang leader, 15 Division must race to find the killer before a gang war breaks out.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Going Under
programme.desc: When 15 Division goes undercover at a club-land bar that’s a possible hub for illegal handguns, Chris’s erratic behavior and concern for a specific drug dealer make Dov suspicious.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Two Truths and a Lie
programme.desc: As the officers of 15 Division try to hunt down the killer of Brian Gowdy – Andy and Sam go on the road to interview a list of inmates at Millburn Penitentiary.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Deal with the Devil
programme.desc: In the midst of a chaotic day at the station, Oliver prepares Andy to defend herself at Duncan’s dismissal hearing, now happening two hours from now.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Exit Strategy
programme.desc: Chris’s addiction issues come to a head when an innocuous call to a middle-class home puts Dov and Chris in the middle of a suspicious home invasion investigation.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: "Moving Day"
programme.desc: 15 Division is assigned to a community outreach program, “Moving Day”, to help tenants move out of a subsidized-housing complex that’s being torn down.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Fragments
programme.desc: Andy’s former rookie, Duncan, is back on duty and looking to reconcile – something she’s not ready for yet. But personal feelings get thrust aside when a bomb explodes in a downtown parking garage.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Everlasting
programme.desc: The officers of 15 Division work to track down TED MCDONALD (the car-bomber from Ep. 510). But even after catching him, they realize Ted has more targets set to explode out there. The clock is ticking.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Open Windows
programme.desc: Andy is attacked by an intruder at Traci’s place and the Sex Crimes Unit steps in to take over the case their way, 15 Division will have decide whether to take matters into their own hands.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Perfect Family
programme.desc: Andy’s ideas about what makes a perfect family are put into perspective when she meets an out-of-control teen who needs to be protected from her own conservative family.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Uprising
programme.desc: A riot breaks out at a women’s correctional institute while Andy, Juliet, Nick, and Gail are there to transfer prisoners. They end up in a lock-down situation that finds Andy and Juliet trapped with a woman desperate to prove her innocence.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Letting Go
programme.desc: When Nick’s estranged older brother emerges with new information on someone from their tragic past, Nick goes off the grid to track the man down. But Juliet is hot on his heels, and Nick is forced to let her into the secrets of his past.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: A Real Gentleman
programme.desc: When Traci is a no-show for her first raid, 15 Division fears the notorious gun dealer they’re after has kidnapped her. But when Andy realizes that the serial rapist we never caught is back, it’s all hands on deck to find Traci.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Home Run
programme.desc: After a community-outreach baseball game erupts in a drive-by shooting, Gail’s relationship with her brother is put to the test . Meanwhile, Swarek plans a getaway with Andy up to Oliver’s cabin, which goes off the rails in every possible way.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Best Man
programme.desc: Andy and Sam are shocked to learn that Oliver is the prime suspect in IA’s corruption investigation into 15 Division. They only have until end of day today to find Chris Klem – the missing explosives-dealer – and clear Oliver’s name.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Integrity Test
programme.desc: With Oliver still the prime suspect in the bombing of 15’s evidence room, Andy, Dov, Gail, and Nick undertake a risky – and potentially career-ending – plan to prove that Commissioner Alonso Santana is corrupt.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Ninety Degrees
programme.desc: Andy heads out with a very-pregnant Marlo to find a volatile woman who’s gone missing after group therapy, but neither Andy nor Marlo are prepared when Marlo suddenly goes into labor.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: Breaking Up the Band
programme.desc: Now that Sam and Marlo’s baby girl has arrived (Ep. 520), it’s clear nothing could have prepared Andy for this moment. So when Juliet offers Andy an opportunity to leave town for 4 months on an undercover project, Andy starts to consider it.

programme.title: Rookie Blue: 74 Epiphanies
programme.desc: Andy and Sam’s wedding comes just in time for the gang to celebrate one last hurrah. But when Andy is taken off-course by a hitchhiker and then stranded on the side of a dead-end road with a dying man, she finds herself with no way to get help.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! Most Haunted
programme.desc: With the team on edge, they explore deeper into the darkness of this incredible place of mystery and secrets. Is the feeling of unease just in their minds or is something about to reveal itself.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Saltmarshe Hall Part 2
programme.desc: Saltmarshe Hall is a mysterious, haunted house of complete contrasts. Beneath the property lies a network of corridors and cellar rooms and the abandoned North Wing has sat empty for over 70 years,.

programme.title: Most Haunted: The Galleries of Justice
programme.desc: The legendary ghost hunters continue in Nottingham and a place where people could be jailed, sentenced and executed without even leaving the building.

programme.title: Most Haunted: The National Emergency Services Gallery
programme.desc: A terrifying place full of history and paranormal activity. The team are tested as the try\nto find the spirits that refuse to leave this famous location.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Ye Olde Kings Head
programme.desc: The Great British pub may be on the decline but in some paranormal activity seems to be on the rise and the Ye Olde Kings Head is one of the most haunted.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Annison Funeral Parlour
programme.desc: Coffins, murder and a malevolent spirit plague the team as they investigate this one-time funeral home. With one member isolated alone another in a coffin the team catch a poltergeist in action.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Capesthorne Hall
programme.desc: The beauty of this magnificent Cheshire country house hides the horror that lies in its corridors. As well a poltergeist activity the team manage to catch some of their best evidence to date and even our sceptic hears noises.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Fort Paull Part 1
programme.desc: Part 1 of this terrifying place concentrates above ground. The team are alarmed at the results from a new piece of equipment and Yvette meets her match.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Fort Paull Part 2
programme.desc: Part 2. The Most Haunted team explore the underground of Fort Paull. With its foundations and footprint dating back 100’s of years the team are faced with some terrifying ordeals.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Knottingley Town Hall
programme.desc: This location is said to be overflowing with paranormal activity, which doesn’t disappoint.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Oakwell House
programme.desc: The team investigate Oakwell House near Leeds, which was built by ancestors of Fred Batt. In 1684, William Batt returned unexpectedly from a trip to London but vanished leaving a bloody footprint. A demon dog has been seen in the grounds.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Tatton Hall
programme.desc: Something about Tatton Old Hall keeps bringing the Most Haunted team back. Something happens that stops two of the team entering, a poltergeist causes confusion and the team get a clear voice from beyond the veil.

programme.title: Most Haunted: The Tivoli Venue
programme.desc: A well-known venue for accomplished as well as up and coming bands The Tivoli Venue boasts many a ghost. In this episode one of the team gets a warning from the other side that reduces them to tears and something seems to be stalking the team.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Hill House_PT1
programme.desc: What was once a private home before becoming a sanctuary for the elderly, the abandoned Hill House is now an eerie shadow of its former glory, that houses empty rooms, strange noises and a plethora of paranormal activity.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Hill House_PT2
programme.desc: Part one saw the team seemingly getting stalked by something, and in this part it shows its hand.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Old Nick Theatre
programme.desc: Once a prison and a police station and now a theatre the Old Nick is famous for its unexplained occurrences. Fred decides to summon up some extra help while objects move and something wants to make itself known.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Thackray Museum
programme.desc: The medical museum houses a great many objects from its distant hospital and workhouse past with a complete Victorian street scene on the lower level.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Village Church Farm
programme.desc: A museum like no other, this small collection of antiquated buildings is said to be the home of several spirits. The team get more than they bargained for as objects move; strange noises are caught on camera and the best EVP response to date.

programme.title: Most Haunted: HMP Shrewsbury Part 1
programme.desc: Yvette Fielding and her team take on their biggest challenge yet in a prison where many have lost their lives and some seem to have remained.

programme.title: Most Haunted: HMP Shrewsbury Part 2
programme.desc: Part two of this mammoth investigation takes the team to the condemned cell and execution room. Is it a hangman or one of the executed souls that makes itself present and causes the team to re-evaluate what they are doing.

programme.title: Most Haunted: HMP Shrewsbury Part 3
programme.desc: The concluding part of the teams biggest investigation sees Yvette get the biggest shock of.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Halsham House
programme.desc: Nestled into the British countryside is Halsham house where a poltergeist hides in wait for the team with frightening effect. With bones found in the attic have the team pushed it too far.

programme.title: Most Haunted: Lyceum Theatre
programme.desc: The Lyceum Theatre in Crewe is known for its paranormal activity and in this episode the team take the fight right to phantoms that lurk in its darkness with some frightening consequences.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! Most Haunted
programme.desc: The team are still spread thinly across this huge location and without the safety of numbers some of the investigators seem easy prey.

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! Most Haunted
programme.desc: The last part sees the team reach their limits as the spirits of this enormous location continue to emerge from the shadows. But will the enormity of the paranormal activity prove too much for the world-famous team.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt1
programme.desc: The famous Air Museum in Doncaster houses many an artefact of aviation history and many spirit from its past. Karl investigates one of the huts that is said to be full of paranormal happenings, and he isn’t disappointed.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt2
programme.desc: The main hanger of Doncaster Air Museum is a vast building and houses flying aircraft of every kind. Stuart ventures alone and soon realises something is there with him.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Dorchester Prison 2 P1
programme.desc: Said to be the Most Haunted prison in the UK, HMP Dorchester is a scary place to be with a group of people but alone it becomes terrifying. Karl investigates the upper cells and gets more than he bargained for.(n)

programme.title: NEW & EXCLUSIVE! Most Haunted
programme.desc: The last part sees the team reach their limits as the spirits of this enormous location continue to emerge from the shadows. But will the enormity of the paranormal activity prove too much for the world-famous team.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Doncaster Air Museum Pt2
programme.desc: The main hanger of Doncaster Air Museum is a vast building and houses flying aircraft of every kind. Stuart ventures alone and soon realises something is there with him.(n)

programme.title: Most Haunted: Unseen: Dorchester Prison 2 P1
programme.desc: Said to be the Most Haunted prison in the UK, HMP Dorchester is a scary place to be with a group of people but alone it becomes terrifying. Karl investigates the upper cells and gets more than he bargained for.(n)

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Knights of the Living Dead
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS travels to Worcester, Massachusetts to investigate the Higgins Armory, the only armory in the western hemisphere devoted to arms and armor.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Touched By Evil
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters,TAPS heads to The Southern Mansion in Cape May, NJ, and have enlisted the help of Dave Tango's father, Bruce.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: A Shot in the Dark
programme.desc: On this episode of Ghost Hunters, TAPS visits the location of the \\"shot heard round the world\\" at the Colonial Inn in Concord, Massachusetts.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Episode 5
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: New Hampshire Gothic
programme.desc: The TAPS team heads to New Hampshire to help a group of volunteers figure out what is causing the lively paranormal activity in their otherwise quiet museum.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters
programme.desc: Despite mysterious and unnerving warnings from locals, the Ghost Hunters face their fears and stay on mission: to help people confront terrifying paranormal encounters that have shaken them to their core.

programme.title: Ghost Hunters: Unexplained Phenomena

programme.desc: The contestants must find keys for lockers containing various cuts of steak, then prepare a delicious dish in under 35 minutes. Dinner service sees the return of steak night.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: The chefs are given a communication challenge. VIP guests for dinner service include astronaut Buzz Aldrin.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA
programme.desc: Dinner sees the 12 remaining chefs serving octopus, steak and lobster, but lacklustre performances from both teams leave Gordon Ramsay far from impressed.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen USA

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.title: Undercover Boss Canada

programme.desc: Rick Silva became CEO of Checkers & Rallys fast food restaurants five years ago, and immediately focused on growing the business at any cost. So he is going undercover to find even more ways to drive sales and please his guests.

programme.desc: Dina Dwyer-Owens, the Chairwoman and CEO of The Dwyer Group, which is the parent company to a collection of franchise brands specializing in home and vehicle maintenance, goes undercover posing as a contestant on a show called Keep Your Day Job.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Adapt, Improvise, and Overcome
programme.desc: Lou takes his new guys on their very first repo but, when the debtors attack with chainsaws, Ronnie and Carlos are left to fend for themselves.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Deep Dish Disaster
programme.desc: Lou plans an elaborate sting operation to infiltrate a cult, but everything goes awry when the new guys aren't prepared and Matt is left picking up the pieces.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Traffic Jammin'
programme.desc: The team gets back to work, but have their anger management sessions had any effect? Sonia and Lyndah confront a gang of roller derby girls who've got the skills to protect their car.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Repo Arigato, Mr. Roboto
programme.desc: The team gets back to work, but have their anger management sessions had any effect? Sonia and Lyndah confront a gang of roller derby girls who've got the skills to protect their car.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Inane Clown Posse
programme.desc: Froy and Matt have to wrangle with some angry clowns when they try to repossess a bouncy castle. Meanwhile, Lou and Sonia lose patience with a debtor over a recycling truck.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Doggin' and Draggin'
programme.desc: When Carlos plays a repossession prank that almost lands Matt and Froy in jail, Lou tasks Froy with burying the hatchet.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Raising the Roof
programme.desc: Sonia and Froy deal with an unbalanced debtor who threatens to take down the entire company, while Matt and Ronnie take on children's book vendors who are up to no good.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Revenge
programme.desc: Matt and Froy take the opportunity to enact revenge on Ronnie and Carlos; a repo at a car wash gets out of hand; Lou's big mistake on a repo results in a debtor bringing the fight to their front door in a shootout.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Gypsy Hunter
programme.desc: Reeling from the shootout, Lou tracks down one of the culprits and enacts an elaborate plot of revenge with the help of Froy and Carlos.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Gypsy Barbeque!
programme.desc: When Matt and Froy repo a car from an anger management meeting, Froy suffers the consequences of taking on a violent rage-aholic.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Up in Flames
programme.desc: A jazz musician sets off Sonia and punches are thrown as Ronnie tries to manage the mayhem, and Matt and Sonia wrestle to bring deluded actors back to reality.

programme.title: Operation Repo: Gypsy Games
programme.desc: When Rusty leads Sonia and Ronnie on a wild goose chase, Sonia loses her cool and puts her foot down with Lou.

programme.title: Operation Repo: T-Bone Trouble
programme.desc: The team's work with anger management starts to pay off - with disastrous consequences. Matt and Sonia get into a standoff with a wealthy divorcee, his daughter, and her raging boyfriend.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Big Picture
programme.desc: When his mother cuts off Russell’s trust fund, he gets a taste of how life will be after moving in with Timmy. Meanwhile, Audrey helps Jeff impress his boss in order to get a raise.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Fun Run
programme.desc: After Jeff tells his altruistic co-workers that requests for charity donations are getting out of hand, Audrey enters into a 10K charity event and plans on having Jeff's staff contribute money toward the cause.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Refusing To Budget
programme.desc: Timmy convinces Russell he needs a budget when the utilities are turned off in his apartment. Meanwhile, Audrey has a mentee who wants to see her office and learn about publishing.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Little Bummer Boy
programme.desc: When Russell decides to borrow a holiday concept of gift-giving from Adam, both Adam and his co-workers are in for surprises. Meanwhile, Audrey wants to make people laugh at Jeff's holiday party.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Home Stretch
programme.desc: When Jeff discovers that a guy is giving Audrey home Pilates classes, he wants to make a change. Meanwhile, Adam tells Jennifer specifics about his football past.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Uh-Oh It's Magic
programme.desc: When Russell takes his date to a magic show, the magician makes her disappear. Meanwhile, Audrey unknowingly slips up when she tells Brenda's girlfriend about the baby.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Singing and Dancing
programme.desc: When Timmy joins an a cappella group, he wants to keep it a secret from Russell. Meanwhile, Jeff and Audrey discover they have a new annoying neighbor.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Anniversary Chicken
programme.desc: When Jeff decides to surprise Audrey by remembering their anniversary, he's the one who ends up being surprised. Meanwhile, Timmy is forced to be Russell's interpreter on a date.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Jeff's Day
programme.desc: When Jeff proclaims it's 'Jeff Day', he gets his way until the cleaning lady arrives. Meanwhile, Adam has to figure out why his eye is twitching.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Zygote
programme.desc: When Jeff and Audrey see a fertility specialist with their surrogate, they discover a zygote. Meanwhile, Russell and Timmy go on double dates again.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Set Up
programme.desc: When Russell discovers Timmy has a sister, he aims to impress her. Meanwhile, Jeff and Audrey set their neighbor Liz up on a date.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Beating the System
programme.desc: When Jeff and Audrey learn their surrogate is pregnant, both of their lives change. Meanwhile, Timmy takes on the responsibility of wedding planner for Adam and Jennifer.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Jeff Photo
programme.desc: When an old photo of Jeff appears in an art gallery, he decides it's time to make some changes in his life. Meanwhile, Russell experiences a slump with women until he sees a familiar face.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Power Couple
programme.desc: Jeff is threatened when Audrey gets a raise and makes almost as much as he does. Meanwhile, Russell enlists Timmy to find out what Liz sees in another man.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Double Down
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey panic when they are told they might be having twins. Meanwhile, Russell throws a citizenship party for Timmy to impress a girl.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cheating
programme.desc: Audrey tries to persuade Jeff to eat healthier when he is diagnosed with high cholesterol, but he can’t help sneaking around with Brenda for unhealthy food.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Scavenger Hunt
programme.desc: To try to show his care and interest in their relationship, Jeff sends Audrey on a scavenger hunt, as suggested by Adam. Russell thinks Jennifer has a sex tape and enlists Timmy’s help in finding it.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Last of the Red Hat Lovers
programme.sub-title: The Last of the Red Hat Lovers
programme.desc: Russell books a cruise that he thinks is filled with 'red hot' ladies but instead, it's filled with ladies from the Red Hat society. Meanwhile, Timmy tries to help Jeff and Audrey settle an argument.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Dirty Talk
programme.desc: Russell tries to get out of his marriage to an overly enthused Liz, who tries to make it work, while Jeff attempts to engage Audrey in dirty talk.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Bros Before Nodes
programme.desc: Worried about getting his father's approval, Russell gets Liz all dolled up to meet him.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Audrey Is Dumb
programme.desc: Jeff celebrates Audrey's inability to talk after her node removal surgery. Russell gets Timmy to fire an employee for him, and Adam discovers he's only getting free stuff because of his good looks.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Nature Calls
programme.desc: Everyone spends a weekend in Vermont to watch the leaves change. During the trip, Adam gets poison ivy on his hands, Jeff has an embarrassing experience on the inn's computer, and Liz begins to realize that her marriage is a sham.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Shy Dial
programme.desc: Jeff uses an app on his phone that automatically puts his calls through to Audrey's voicemail. Meanwhile, Adam befriends a clothing salesman who helps him against his friends when he picks up some questionable clothing choices.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cheating
programme.desc: Audrey tries to persuade Jeff to eat healthier when he is diagnosed with high cholesterol, but he can’t help sneaking around with Brenda for unhealthy food.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Chair
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey engage in a battle of wills when she refuses to admit that she hates the armchair she ordered while Jeff pretends to love it.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Scavenger Hunt
programme.desc: To try to show his care and interest in their relationship, Jeff sends Audrey on a scavenger hunt. Russell thinks Jennifer has a sex tape and enlists Timmy's help in finding it.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: A Big Bust
programme.desc: Audrey believes her maid needs an operation to correct the limp she has to be able to walk better, thinking she is doing the right thing Audrey asks her neighbors to contribute to the cause not having any idea what the money is really intended for.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: After The Lovin'
programme.desc: Frustrated by his boss blaming him for burning his mouth on hot soup, Timmy has a special spoon created for Russell. Audrey's plan backfires when she tries to seduce Jeff in the bedroom in order to get him to complete household tasks.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Missed Connections
programme.desc: Timmy wants to reconnect with a woman he met on the subway; Jeff and Audrey turn on each other when former friends snub them.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Five Things
programme.desc: Jeff can't think of five nice things to say about Audrey; Russell encourages Timmy to serenade a woman; Jennifer and Adam mistakenly get Jeff and Audrey's bank statement.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Meat Wars
programme.desc: Audrey drags Jen to a Bon Jovi concert to prove that she's still young and fun, leaving Jeff and Adam at home. Russell finds a phone number in his pocket and asks Timmy to investigate.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Goodbye Dolly
programme.desc: Audrey tries to prepare for motherhood by continuing to repair a doll that she keeps damaging. Meanwhile, Jeff questions whether the very pregnant Brenda should be dating anymore, and Adam tries to convince Jennifer that he is a manly man.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Audrey's Shower
programme.desc: Jen puts the wrong date on the invitations to Audrey's baby shower, Jeff likes Audrey's maternity clothes, and Russell gives up women.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Liz Moves In
programme.desc: Liz temporarily moves in with Jeff and Audrey. Jeff isn't happy with the new guest, but changes his mind when he discovers Liz consistently takes his side against Audrey.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Taking Names
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey realize that the names on their baby list are also the names of women that Russell has slept with. Adam becomes a cycling enthusiast after Jennifer suggests they start riding bikes in the park.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cats & Dogs
programme.desc: Feeling lonely after her cat dies, Liz looks for a sperm donor. When Timmy's intellect and innocence don't attract his crush, he tries his hand at playing 'big dog.' Adam rips the vintage wedding dress that Jennifer's family sent her.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cupcake
programme.desc: Russell gets jealous when Timmy manages to outshine him at his own pick-up game. Adam and Jennifer leave pot-laced cupcakes on the kitchen counter, and an unaware Jeff eats one.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Fountain Of Youth
programme.desc: After meeting up with college friends who are no longer into partying, Jeff and Audrey set out to prove that even with a baby on the way, they can still have fun. Meanwhile, Timmy attempts to find Russell's compassionate side.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Baby Talk
programme.desc: When Audrey bonds with their unborn baby by reading her stories, a paranoid Jeff believes that she is trying to form an alliance against him. Meanwhile, Russell steals an article that Timmy wrote.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Role Play
programme.desc: Jeff promises to take Audrey to an upmarket and very popular restaurant but forgets to book a table. Determined to dine there, he hatches a plan to get in by claiming that a last-minute reservation is needed for a celebrity.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Catering
programme.desc: Brenda enlists Jeff and Audrey's help when she does the catering for an event at Columbia University. While waitressing, Audrey tries to fit in with the guests, only to discover that they are more impressed with Jeff's bartending skills.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Cooking Class
programme.desc: The couples attempt to enjoy recreational cooking classes together, but Jeff and Adam can't keep their competitive nature out of the kitchen. Russell doesn't notice how disturbingly similar his new girlfriend is to Timmy.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Unpleasant Surprises
programme.desc: When Jennifer learns that the guys have nothing planned for Adam's last weekend as a bachelor, she plans a party weekend. Things don't go as planned, however, so Jeff, Russell, and Timmy must improvise.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Timmy Quits
programme.desc: Audrey has always had suspicions that Jeff's old college friend Heidi harbours romantic feelings for him, so Jeff invites Heidi over to prove that this was never the case.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: A Wee Problem
programme.desc: Jeff does his best to make a heavily pregnant Brenda laugh when he discovers that she has a `wee problem' due to her condition, but his antics cause her waters to break. Meanwhile, Adam annoys Audrey with his non-stop chatter during a spa visit.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: 100th
programme.desc: Brenda goes into labor on Jen and Adam's wedding day, but Jeff has reservations about being in the delivery room. Adam persuades Jen to make some alternative arrangements for their marriage ceremony.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Rules of Engagement: Pilot
programme.desc: Adam and Jennifer are a 20-something couple who have gotten engaged and moving in together after just seven months of dating. Meanwhile, their neighbors Jeff and Audrey who have been married for twelve years try to set a good example.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Birthday Deal
programme.desc: Though he's unhappy that Audrey spent more than usual for his birthday party, Jeff wants to stay on her good side to ensure he gets his yearly birthday deal. Though Jeff won't reveal the 'deal.'.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: The Young and the Restless
programme.desc: After Adam has too many restless nights sleeping in Jennifer’s small bed, he brings home the bed he shared with his ex-girlfriend which causes a fight and leads them tossing out all memories of past relationships.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Hard Day's Night
programme.desc: Jennifer tries to help Jeff’s sore neck with a massage until the situation between them becomes uncomfortable and upsets Audrey. Meanwhile, Russell brings Adam along to help him fight off a school yard bully so Russell can get close to the teacher.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Kids
programme.desc: Adam and Jennifer’s plans for a romantic weekend fall apart after they argue about their different feelings toward careers, finances, and kids. Meanwhile, Audrey is having second thoughts about why she and Jeff have waited so long to have children.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Game on
programme.desc: After Adam buys an expensive video-game console, Jennifer makes him promise to discuss major purchases first, but Russell interferes and makes Adam question the agreement.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Jeff's Wooby
programme.desc: Audrey surprises Jeff by making quilt out of his old t-shirts but regrets her gift when he doesn't stop telling the stories that are behind the shirts.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Mr. Fix-It
programme.desc: Jeff and Audrey tackle marital communication issues while Adam and Jennifer discover whether creating a home-made 'videotape' will spice up their love life.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Flirting With Disaster
programme.desc: Adam enjoys stealing the attention of Russell's female admirers, prompting fiance Jennifer to lay down the law and Russell to seek revenge. Meanwhile, Jeff learns an important lesson about sleep deprivation.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Audrey's Sister
programme.desc: A surprise visit from Audrey's sister Barbara opens a window of opportunity for Russell to prove that beauty is more than what meets the eye - or at least a function of personality and good strategy.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Guy Code
programme.desc: In an effort to beef up their social agenda, Audrey persuades Jeff to double-date, which inadvertently puts the rules governed by the 'guy code' versus the 'marriage code' to the test.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Engagement Party
programme.desc: In an effort to capitalize on his commitment to Jennifer, Adam convinces Jeff to host an engagement party, which ultimately provides a lesson in 'giving' and 'receiving.' Audrey gains an unsolicited insight into her sister Barbara's single life.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Bag Ladies
programme.desc: Russell realizes the cost of dating a 'bag lady,' while Adam experiences the social peril of yielding to Jennifer's wishes and sporting a 'man bag.'.(n)

programme.desc: In an effort to capitalize on his commitment to Jennifer, Adam convinces Jeff to host an engagement party, which ultimately provides a lesson in 'giving' and 'receiving.' Audrey gains an unsolicited insight into her sister Barbara's single life.(n)

programme.title: Rules of Engagement: Bag Ladies
programme.desc: Russell realizes the cost of dating a 'bag lady,' while Adam experiences the social peril of yielding to Jennifer's wishes and sporting a 'man bag.'.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Surprise Ending
programme.desc: Dog and the boys are going after a fugitive with a $25,000 bond and a string of theft charges behind him. When the team hits his apartment, they find a boot print on the door, a souvenir of a police raid from only days earlier?

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Big Wipe-Out
programme.desc: A Hawaiian surfing hero is on a wave to nowhere and it's Dog's turn to play lifeguard. "Buttons," known throughout the islands for his prowess on the waves and his daring 360's, has wiped-out on the rocky shoals of drug addiction.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: You Can Bet On It!
programme.desc: Kristine had a string of gambling and forgery charges before she jumped bail leaving Dog "holding the bag". Now it's time for Dog to call in some chits of his own, getting the help of trusty informants he's helped out over the years.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Fly Boy
programme.desc: Dog told him not to go, but Charles went anyway, skipping to Oregon against the terms of his bail. Now Dog has a tip that Charles plans to slip back into Honolulu. With $30,000 on the line Dog knows he can leave little to chance.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Guns & Ice
programme.desc: The following day is Dog's birthday but that won't stop him from chasing a fugitive, who is facing firearms charges. Dog doesn't relish the thought of going after an alleged gunslinger on his birthday but he's never one to avoid a challenge.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Good Fight
programme.desc: Dog and Beth have to be at the state capitol bright and early to receive an award for their fight against ice in Hawaii. Afterwards, they're inspired to start the hunt for Shanna, an alleged ice user and identity thief with $80,000 in bonds.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Smackdown of Baby Lyssa
programme.desc: After meeting with the cosigner on a bond for a man named John, Dog and the Posse hatch a plan to lure him to a high rise apartment. But when night falls, their plan leaves a member of the team alone and in harm's way!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: A Friend in Need
programme.desc: Roger has 27 prior arrests, spent years in jail and doesn't want to go back. But he's missed court and now Dog has to bring him in. To complicate matters, this fugitive lives in a tightly-knit community where good information won't come easy.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Your Lying Eyes
programme.desc: Kolani's on the run, left his wife to look after four kids and left Dog holding the bag for the $10k bond. So their pursuit on this case takes them into some parts of Ohau, and the human heart, that few of us will ever see.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Crime Don't Pay
programme.desc: Today the crew is hunting for Holly, a car thief. She's one of Tim's bonds and the entire Dog crew knows that means trouble - or at least a long and difficult chase.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Twisted Love
programme.desc: Dog is tracking down Cecilia, who's wanted for car theft, but she's nowhere to be found. Her girlfriend and co-signer has gone missing too. Just when the trail goes cold, a friend leads the team to the cosigner's empty apartment.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Where the Wild Things Are
programme.desc: Dog, Beth and the team are in Colorado and they face a special challenge - getting the kids to camp. After the drop-off, Dog is more than ready to track down a fugitive. Robin disposed of a body after a homicide, and now he's skipped his court date.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: No Luv Still
programme.desc: Dog is in search of a potentially dangerous fugitive, he's only 19 and charged with kidnapping and menacing. The case takes an unexpected turn when the Chapman clan ends up in a confrontation with the suspect's family.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Day of the Dog
programme.desc: Dog and the team are back in Colorado hunting bounties. Today's fugitive has a long rap sheet and a reputation for packing heat. With nothing but an address and phone number, the team heads out on the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Time to Cry
programme.desc: Kimo does a vanishing act for his day in court and now Dog and the posse have to find him. With precious few leads to follow Dog turns to the fugitive's on-again-off-again girlfriend, but she's initially reluctant to join the hunt.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Up on the Roof
programme.desc: Today, Dog and the family are back in Colorado and are about to make one of their most exciting captures ever. When the adrenaline-fueled arrest goes down, every family member will play a critical role.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Family Business
programme.desc: Dog and the Chapman clan start their hunt today with another well-established bail bonding family. As Dog's fame has grown, so have his responsibilities.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Felons Interrupted
programme.desc: Dog is confronted with two alleged felons in crisis. Family and friends of these bondees are convinced that they are getting into further trouble while awaiting trial, so Dog and the posse have to bring these men back to jail.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Let It Snow
programme.desc: Christopher is barely 21, already has a history of domestic abuse and assault, and is facing major time in a room without a view. This hunt won't be easy for Dog - the leads are few, informers and family are not forthcoming.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Rush from Judgment
programme.desc: Facing hard time for forging checks, Melissa pulled a vanishing act at her sentencing hearing, bolting from the courthouse in broad daylight. Lucky for her bondsman, Dog and his posse are in Colorado and ready to help.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Burn & Return
programme.desc: Dog is busy. First, he's after a fugitive who is allegedly an expert in the game of "burn and return"- shoplifting goods to return them for cash refunds. But he's not easy to track.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Stormy Weather
programme.desc: Going after two fugitives in one day is tough enough without the facing Colorado's notoriously unpredictable weather. Today, it's the threat of severe thunderstorms, hail and area wide tornado warnings.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: One for the Money
programme.desc: It hurts Dog to see people who after years of walking the straight and narrow, suddenly lose their way. But today's case is a member of the law enforcement community who has recently gone astray, and that truly troubles the Dog.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Reality Check
programme.desc: Dog is back in Denver and in hot pursuit of a woman wanted for identity theft. The sad reality is that the identify which has been robbed is her own. She's traded in a bright future for a life on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: No Piece of Cake
programme.desc: Being hunted by the Dog is a lousy way to celebrate your birthday but that's exactly the spot that Robert finds himself in today. He's missed his court date, quit his job, and vacated his last known address.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Prayers and Mace
programme.desc: Both brother Tim and fellow Honolulu bondsman James need Dog's help to track down their hard to find fugitives. The two cases on the docket today are challenging, especially the hunt for Gregory, a felon with a lengthy rap sheet.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: New Dog in Town
programme.desc: It's Beth's birthday and Dog knows just what she needs. He surprises Beth with Delilah, a puppy small enough to sit in the palm of her hand. Beth is so happy that she insists on taking the puppy with her on today's bounty.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Trick or Treat
programme.desc: It's Halloween, and before Dog and Beth can help the kids carve their pumpkins, they have some business to attend to. It involves knocking on doors and meeting the neighbors but instead of hunting for treats they're on the search for a fugitive.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Girl Trouble
programme.desc: Dog and the team have girl trouble in this case. Krystal jumped bail and seems to have vanished into the high plains of Colorado. To make matters worse, she's running with her lover (and bond co-signer) Carrie. But Thelma and Louise they ain't.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Seeing the Light
programme.desc: Today Leland and Dog make a quick visit to the police supply store to get some new gadgets for the team but they can't linger because they've also got a fugitive to catch. Their target is reputed to have an explosive temper.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: When a Stranger Calls
programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call - The Dog!? And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Jack & Jill
programme.desc: Today's case is a twofer, a brother and sister both charged with drug related offenses. Also, Dog has crossed paths with the brother before. He once tried to stop Dog from arresting one of the most violent fugitives of his career.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Island Hopper
programme.desc: When a brother bondsman from Washington State calls Dog for help tracking a runner in search of fun in the sun on the tropical paradise of Kauai, the team gets on the case. Dog's only problem? No leads!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Nice Guys Finish Last
programme.desc: Dog and team help out a bondsman friend whose client jumped bail, but the target is a blank slate. Are his tattoos gang related? Is he likely to be violent? And making matters worse, when they hit his apartment they learn he is moving out.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Back Behind Bars
programme.desc: While tracking down a potentially dangerous ex-con facing a five year stretch in the big house, Leland struggles to find time to train and compete for his first boxing match in years.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Family Man
programme.desc: Dog and family head to Kona to track down a wanted father who's looking to bolt to the mainland to evade sentencing. Meanwhile, Dog does some evading of his own - Avoiding the much dreaded birthday party!

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: All in the Family
programme.desc: Dog and the team need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives. The case is a family affair with both mother and daughter in trouble with the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Mother Courage
programme.desc: Dog knows that crime and drugs not only damage victims but also harm the families of the perpetrators, especially the kids. And both of the fugitives he's chasing today have left shattered families and struggling women in their wake.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Bounty Boot Camp
programme.desc: Jim is a bondsman and longtime friend of Dog. Jim's son has just started in the family business. Today, Jim has asked Dog to track down a potentially dangerous fugitive, and take his son along for some training with the best in the world.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Friends and Neighbors
programme.desc: Dog and his posse head to Colorado for a special mission, to catch Marco, an alleged drug dealer. It's been ten months since Marco went on the lam, and his bondsman stands to lose his family business if Marco is not caught.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Set-Up
programme.desc: The trail is hot and the stakes is high for Dog and the posse. The "Big Fish" in this case is Marco, an alleged drug dealer with a big bond. But a major key to catching him is Elizabeth, who is also a fugitive from the law.

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Searchers
programme.desc: Dog is still on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog has been tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver, and now a hot tip that a long time associate of his is hiding in Pueblo sends the team racing south.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Buddha's Delight
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Three's Company
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district, moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: The Searchers
programme.desc: Dog is still on the search for the elusive fugitive, Marco. Dog has been tracking him across Colorado, from Grand Junction to Denver, and now a hot tip that a long time associate of his is hiding in Pueblo sends the team racing south.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Buddha's Delight
programme.desc: Dog and the posse travel to the Big Island to help Leland track down a small-time Bonnie and Clyde couple. Their crime: theft, including allegedly stealing a pair of Buddha statues for resale.(n)

programme.title: Dog The Bounty Hunter: Three's Company
programme.desc: This fugitive is hard to pin down in Honolulu's downtown district, moving from hostel to hotel to apartment high-rise. But as the hunt evolves, Dog discovers that this alleged burglar isn't the only family member wanted by the law.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Dance Dads
programme.desc: Willie, Korie, Jase and Missy take dance lessons from Sadie to prepare for Reed and Rebecca's upcoming weddings. Jase's plan to perform Reed's wedding ceremony may fall through when he waits until the last minute to renew his ordainment.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: End of an Era
programme.desc: When Si decides to retire to pursue a music career, the family organizes a party in his honor. Meanwhile, Willie, Phil, and Jase take a road trip to try to recreate an old duck call for Si's retirement gift.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Looking Back and Talking Quack
programme.desc: The Robertson family takes a look back at 130 episodes of Duck Dynasty.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Grass & The Furious
programme.desc: It's all hands on deck for the Duckmen when an old high school nemesis challenges them to a good old-fashioned race.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Driving Miss Sadie
programme.desc: With Sadie's driver's license test fast approaching, she finds herself in dire need of lessons. Willie, Jase and Si each set out to correct her glaring failures behind the wheel by teaching her how to drive... Robertson-style.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Truck Commander
programme.desc: After Willie's son, John Luke, leaves Willie's pickup in the driveway with a bone-dry gas tank, Willie and Korie decide that it's time to get the kid his own car.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Si-Yonara
programme.desc: The Duck Commander assembly room gets an unexpected shakeup when a disgruntled Si decides to quit his job.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Fowl Play
programme.desc: Willie finds his office in shambles and alerts the authorities that the warehouse has had a break in.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Sweatin' Bullets
programme.desc: When a heat wave envelops West Monroe the air conditioning unit at the Duck Commander warehouse goes down, turning the duck call assembly room into a boiling sweatshop.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Spring Pong Cleaning
programme.desc: After Korie decides the junk piles in the Duck Commander warehouse are beginning to reach critical mass, she calls on Willie and the guys to do a little company spring-cleaning.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Good Morning, West Monroe
programme.desc: After attending a local radio show as a guest, Willie sees an opportunity to host a show of his own.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Of Mattresses and Men
programme.desc: The Jase, Si and the guys from the duck call room take a field trip to a brand new local donut shop and quickly find out who amongst them can eat the most delicious treats.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Samurai Si
programme.desc: Willie receives a special gift from a Japanese business associate - a "priceless" samurai sword, which Willie keeps out of the hands of Jase and the guys.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck No, We Won't Go
programme.desc: Willie pushes his work force too far after implementing new "motivational work tactics," and the guys rise up against him and go on strike.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Drag Me To Glory
programme.desc: When NASCAR sensation Clint Bowyer pays a visit to the Duck Commander warehouse, Willie and the guys are fired up to spend the day hanging out with the professional racecar driver.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Season Eve
programme.desc: Tomorrow is the opening day of Duck Season and the men are carrying on their tradition of camping on the Robertson Land the night before.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Can't Hardly Weight
programme.desc: Gearing up for his high school reunion, Willie realizes that he could stand to lose a few pounds. Jase and Korie set out to help him drop some weight and the strenuous battle of man-versus-waistline begins.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Shot Thru The Heart
programme.desc: The guys learn from Willie that John Luke is going through his first break up. In order to make him feel better the men decide to take John Luke hunting for nutria, and impart their relationship wisdom.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Here Lizard, Lizard
programme.desc: When the warehouse guys new office pet (a lizard) escapes, they try all they can in order to catch the wily reptile. Proving impossible, the guys finally decide to bring in the big guns to help trap it--Mr. Phil Robertson.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hallu-Si-Nations
programme.desc: With Willie out-of-town, the guys decide to flake off work and leave to brush up the duck blinds on the Robertson land. While out, Si believes he spots what he thinks is the infamous 'Black Panther'.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Let's Go Hunting, Deer
programme.desc: Willie and Jase invite Korie and Missy along on a deer hunt because they believe their wives have become too "city." At Phil and Kay's, Miss Kay decides she wants to frame Phil's original blueprints from the first duck call he created.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Tickets To The Fun Show
programme.desc: During Duck Commander's "Casino Night" party, Si Robertson wins the grand prize of $2000 and decides to buy a massage chair for the duck call room. The massage chair becomes a detriment to the workflow, so Willie takes Si around for a replacement prize.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Be a Lady
programme.desc: Sadie, has a homecoming dance coming up, but Willie doesn't approve of her dress selection. Willie decides to take Sadie out to find her a new "appropriate" dress.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Ring Around the Redneck
programme.desc: Though Jase lost his wedding ring long ago, Missy decides it's time for Jase to replace it with a new one. When Jase is duck hunting, once again, he loses the ring.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Bass Man Standing
programme.desc: The Duck Commander team is invited to unveil a wing of the local Bass Pro shop that will feature their products.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Battle of the Brothers
programme.desc: Willie's suspicious behavior from dyeing his beard to buying a new motorcycle, makes Jase come to the conclusion that Willie is having a mid-life crisis.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Aloha, Robertsons!
programme.desc: After all their hard work, Willie decides to take the entire Robertson clan on a family vacation to Hawaii. But Willie's daily itinerary for the trip gets constantly undermined by the family's desire to participate in their own island activities.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Till Duck Do Us Part
programme.desc: Everyone comes together to plan a surprise wedding for Phil and Kay, setting up a special ceremony on their land, which the whole family attends. Si distracts Phil and Kay by taking them on a "trip down memory lane".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: So You Think You Can Date?
programme.sub-title: So You Think You Can Date?
programme.desc: After discovering that Martin has to miss a Friday night poker game for a date, the guys (as well as their wives) take turns figuring out the best way to coach him for romance. When babysitting for Jep and Jessica turns into a rocky road.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hot Tub Grime Machine
programme.desc: The guys realize that Godwin has never really asked them for a favor, even though they are all always helping each other out. Godwin asks them to help him get a hot tub, so they set out to help him pick one up.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: A-Jase-ent Living
programme.desc: Due to construction at Jase and Missy's house, Willie and Korie invite Jase and the kids to live with them while Missy is out of town visiting friends. Then, what begins in the duck call room as a series of "Gentlemen's Bets".

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Termite Be a Problem
programme.desc: Because of a termite problem at Duck Commander, the guys are forced to find a different location to work from - Godwin's House. But while at Godwin's house, Godwin gets a taxidermied gift from a past relative.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: John Luke After Dentist
programme.desc: John Luke and Sadie are getting some dental work done, complete with sedation, and it's up to Willie and Korie to take care of them through the process - including getting them back home safely.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Scoot Along Si
programme.desc: Si shows up to work on a mobility scooter, claiming to have an invisible injury from a fender bender with Willie. After losing her beloved turtle "Mr. T", Ms. Kay enlists Phil on a mission to find a new pet turtle.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Jerky Boys
programme.desc: A decision to try and make some duck jerky leads the boys to Godwin's garage and a minibike race. Phil and Kay have made Willie the executor of their will, and Phil wants to show Willie what he and his brothers will inherit when he and Kay pass away.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Going Si-ral
programme.desc: Si discovers Youtube, and, after watching a series of instructional videos, decides he can make something better. John Luke totals Willie's truck, and Willie realizes he may be raising the two worst drivers in all of Louisiana.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack-O-Lantern
programme.desc: The Robertsons host a Halloween event at Duck Commander, where they all come together to transform the warehouse into a "scarehouse." Everyone dresses up and Willie desperately tries to be the scariest, but none of the kids are afraid of him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: O Little Town of West Monroe
programme.sub-title: O Little Town of West Monroe
programme.desc: The Robertsons perform a live nativity for their Church for Christmas, so the wives organize rehearsals to ensure that they pull off a great event. However, rehearsals get off to a bumpy start as the guys can't stop sharing their opinions.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Boomerang Becca
programme.desc: When Rebecca returns home from her internship in Los Angeles, the Robertson family plans a big surprise party to welcome her back. Meanwhile, when Uncle Si gets sick, he seeks the help of Ms. Kay to take care of him.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Willie's Number Two
programme.desc: When Willie is looking to hire a new assistant, Korie insists he interviews her cousin, JD. Meanwhile, when Uncle Si spends the day over at Phil and Kay's, Jep stops by with the kids to keep them away from Jessica, who has taken ill.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Life of Si
programme.desc: After seeing footage Jep shot using a GoPro, Si decides he wants to use the camera to record a day in his life. But when Si gets on the guys nerves while they're hunting, they kick him and his GoPros out of the blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: From Duck 'til Dawn
programme.desc: When the duck guys have to pull an all-nighter to finish some work, Willie decides he wants to join them. But when a dying smoke detector distracts them from their work, Jase and Willie head off to disarm it.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Burger Commander
programme.desc: After visiting a popular burger restaurant, Willie and Jase get into a debate over which of them cooks the best burger, prompting them to challenge one another to a cooking contest.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: G.I. Si
programme.desc: When Willie and Jase argue over an old G.I. Joe toy, it leads them into a debate over who would make a better soldier. To settle the score, Willie and Jase head out to the woods with their friends and children for a paintball match.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Jase and the Argonauts
programme.desc: When Willie gets a soft serve machine for himself, he tells the guys they can't use it until they're done working. But when Jase thinks this is unfair, he takes matters into his own hands and finds a better object to use as motivation.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Fowl Playhouse
programme.desc: When Jase finds out Jep is planning to buy his kids a fancy playhouse from a catalogue, he and the guys decide to build one for Jep themselves. But the playhouse ends up looking more like a military-style duck blind.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: The Big LeCOWski
programme.desc: When Sadie spends the day at Duck Commander for a school project, the guys try to show her the ins-and-outs of how a successful company works. But when Willie questions Jase's ingenuity in creating new products they get into a debate.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Duck Dynasty
programme.desc: The Robertson family pulls together a family reunion to give Mia a big send-off before her surgery.

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Governor's Travels
programme.desc: When the Governor of Louisiana announces that he will be coming to Duck Commander to present Willie with a commerce award, John Luke volunteers to give the introduction speech.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack and Gown
programme.desc: With Reed's graduation day approaching, Jase decides to take Reed frog hunting the night before, like he did on the day of his own graduation. Willie and Si join in, and Jase tries to keep them from imparting their "college advice" on Reed.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Hands on a Woodchipper
programme.desc: When Willie agrees to sponsor Mountain Man's radio contest, a "Hands on a Hardbody" competition, he somehow finds himself competing against Si for Mountain Man's last minute prize: a woodchipper.(n)

programme.title: Duck Dynasty: Quack Draft
programme.desc: When the Robertsons participate in the West Monroe Fire Department pancake breakfast, the firemen invite Willie and his brothers to train with the department for the day. Meanwhile, Phil and Si accompany Miss Kay on a trip to visit a family grave.(n)

programme.desc: The team goes undercover to investigate unexplained deaths in a prison.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: Shalimar is sent undercover in a deadly high-tech assassination ring, to find why they want Adam dead.

programme.title: Mutant X
programme.desc: The team steps in to protect a main prosecution witness whose life has been threatened prior to the trial.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: First of its Kind
programme.desc: Following Boone's confrontation with Hegel that left him severely injured, he was eliminated by Zo'or. Beckett who was impregnated by Hegel gives birth to a boy who immediately grows up to a man.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Avatus
programme.desc: Da'an looses his contact with the the Taelon Commonality. This causes him to change and Zo'or instructs that Da'an must be killed; because he's now considered a threat.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: A Stitch in Time
programme.desc: An exhibition for the first arrival of the Taelons showcases different artifacts. An artifact causes Liam to travel to an alternate time. Zo'or questions how Da'an was able to rejoin the Commonality.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Dimensions
programme.desc: Liam and Augur are in a Taelon shuttle craft, when something happens they get thrown into a parallel universe. They discover that humanity is at war with the Taelons.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Moonscape
programme.desc: Augur is forced to take part in a Taelon experiment. Da'an and Liam try to convince Zo'or that altering minds and implanting humans to make them aggressive to fight the Jaridians is not the correct path. Maiya makes contact with Sandoval.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: The Sleepers
programme.desc: A Jaridian probe lands on Earth and begins sucking energy from the Comonality. The Taelons use humans in a near-death state to keep their connection while Lili and Sandoval try to find out what is draining the energy.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Fissures
programme.desc: When large scale blackouts begin to occur in cities with portals, Taelon technology is blamed. Augur and Liam investigate the death of a portal worker by a strange creature that feeds on energy and is particularly attracted to the Taelons.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Redemption
programme.desc: Siobhan falls while rock climbing. As the others search for her, she dreams that she is on trial for supporting the Taelons. Zo'or questions whether Sandoval's CVI imperative to serve the Taelons has broken down as others are experiencing.

programme.title: Earth: Final Conflict: Between Heaven and Hell
programme.desc: Dr. Belman's daughter does human testing on herself with an accelerant that causes her to rapidly evolve. Joshua Doors decides somebody should run against President Thompson in the election, somebody who will stand up to the Taelons.

programme.title: Sanctuary: Homecoming
programme.desc: Will's trip to Liberia turns bad when he suffers a head trauma from an attack. The trauma brings up powerful memories about his mothers death and the inadequacies of his father. Magnus deals with be-winged scam artist.

programme.title: Sanctuary: Icebreaker
programme.desc: Henry and Declan lead a team to rescue a crew of a Russian icebreaker and the abnormal passengers.

programme.title: Sanctuary: Fugue
programme.desc: FBI Agent Abby Corrigan's life is endangered after she is suddenly attacked by an unfamiliar abnormal during an investigation. Magnus and Will's heated debate over the best way to help Abby threatens to permanently alter their relationship.(n)

programme.title: Sanctuary: Chimera
programme.desc: There is a sentient organic nanite causing havoc in the computer system in the Sanctuary. Magnus and Tesla connect their minds to the system in an effort to isolate the nanite. They find Adam Worth instead.(n)

programme.title: Sanctuary: Acolyte
programme.desc: A radical group of abnormal beings plan a terrorist attack with the goal of starting a war between surface dwellers and hollow Earth inhabitants. To Magnus' disbelief, Addison, at the NSA, has proof of Biggie's leadership of the group.(n)
